fields.description:
h3.Summary

By default, Confluence does not work with mechanisms that would allow labels to be automatically added to pages based on the usage of specific macros. For example, if a certain action item is checked on a page, a label corresponding to that text would be added.

h3.Suggestion

This is a suggestion to allow Confluence to automatically add labels to pages based on what has been checked by using macros like the Action Items one. 

This could help in different reporting scenarios where the checked action item could correspond to a certain action of the company.
fields.summary: Add labels to pages by macro upon using action items

fields.description: In indexing hots, it would be useful to be able to quickly fetch all of the content ids that have been changed within a certain time period quickly. Investigate whether this is possible and if it would be viable to use in a HOT context.
fields.summary: PIR AI - Investigate whether analytics can fetch updated content within a period

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira Service Management users can view Confluence pages when the space is linked to a project without needing a Confluence license to do so.

When adding a Content by label macro to a page from this space, unlicensed users receive a message saying that there is no content to be shown, even if they have access to those pages.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Link a Confluence space to a JSM project.
 # Create a few pages in that space.
 # Add labels to them.
 # Create another page and add the Content by label macro.
 # Choose the labels to display the pages from the space that is linked to the JSM project.
 # Log in as a user who has access only access to JSM and not Confluence.

h3. Expected Results

The unlicensed users should be able to see the pages on the macro.
h3. Actual Results

Users get the following message: "There is no content with the specified labels"
 !Screen Shot 2021-06-14 at 11.19.42.png|thumbnail! 

 
h3. Workaround

Leaving the space open for Anonymous Access will allow users to see the pages in the macro.
fields.summary: Content by label macro doesn't display pages to unlicensed users

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The [Public Links|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/public-links-979425312.html] is a great feature that allows us to share individual pages with non-Confluence users at a global scale, without compromising an entire space setting up Anonymous Access.
 In addition to a [recently discovered bug with this feature and the Audit Logs|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-72271], there is no option to check what are the pages that do have this feature currently enabled.
h3. Suggestion
 * Enable the ability to get a report of the pages in the Confluence site that do have the Public Links to feature enabled.

*Notes*
 The only way it could be done would be to accessing the Audit Logs and searching for the Public Links event, then doing a match of what was enabled and not disabled. As there is the mentioned bug, there is no way to get this information.
h3. Workaround
 * [Identifying pages with Pubic Links enabled through Audit logs of Confluence|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/Identifying-pages-with-Public-Links-enabled-1087528855.html]
fields.summary: Audit pages that are actively shared with Public Links

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Hide Feeds for Anonymous users
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Enable anonymous access to your site and space
 # When anonymous users access the site, Home Page
 # The user sees the feeds from all the Anonymous spaces
 # The Feeds show other user Names (including internal users)
 # though user profile access is prohibited under anonymous configuration.

h3. Expected Results

1) Need to Hide feeds for anonymous users

or

2) Hide Internal users to be shown in the feeds section for anonymous users
h3. Actual Results

The feeds show internal user names for anonymous users.
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Required, if there is no workaround please state:
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Hide Feeds for Anonymous users

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If you have a *page* with the *Office Word Marco* display a .docx file with the scroll bar present. Then create an export of that page. Content will be missing from the PDF or word export file.
h3. Environment
 * Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page
 # Insert the *Office Word Marco*
 # Display an attached .doc file that has content and room to scroll down.
 # Create an export
 # View the pdf or word file and content will be missing.

h3. Expected Results

The export should generate all content on the page even if the *Office Word Macro* is not showing it
h3. Actual Results

The export isn't generating all content on the page if the *Office Word Macro* is not showing it
h3. Notes
h3. Workaround

Currently there is not a workaround for this.
fields.summary: Content Missing when Page Export to word or PDF with Office Word Marco

fields.description: It would be helpful to have the ability to make 'Publish without notifying watchers' the default option for teams that prefer this workflow.
fields.summary: Option to make 'Publish without notifying watchers' the default publishing option
Functionality to customize "Email from" in Confluence
Cannot edit space templates if they have changes in the global template version
Incorrect documentation of page restriction editing permissions for page creators

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In view mode, the Page Properties Report Macro doesn't always load the third-party macros frames.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

(i) this issue cannot be reproduced on every attempt, but it's a valid one happens from time to time
 # Add a Page Properties Macro with a third-party macro in it
 # Add a Page Properties Macro report
 # Save the page
 # Refresh the page. This step is required for the resources to be reloaded, which could lead to them not being always available for the macro to render.

h3. Expected Results

The content of the third-party macro always loads.
h3. Actual Results

The content of the third-party macro sometimes doesn't load.
h3. Workaround

Edit the page and close it again. The required resources are still available right after the page has been published.
fields.summary: The Page Properties Report Macro doesn't always load the third-party macros frames

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In Confluence, when [moving a parent page to a new space|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/move-copy-and-hide-pages/#Move,copy,andhidepages-neweditor], all the child pages will be moved as well.

However, if the user does not have edit restrictions applied to it, only the parent page and pages without restrictions/that the user has 'edit' restriction will be moved.
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # In Confluence, make sure to create a page and another page within it so it will become a child page.
 # Make sure that the child page has 'edit' restrictions implemented to a different user (as a space admin, the user can add restrictions and then, delete the 'edit' one on the *Restricted pages* part).
 # Move the parent page

Observe that only the parent page has been moved and the child page will "disappear" from the sidebar because it has become an orphaned page.
h3. Suggestion

This can give the impression that the child pages were deleted and will require manual efforts to move them as well (add the 'edit' restrictions and move each of them).

This is a suggestion to provide a warning mentioning that the child pages will not be moved and will become orphaned ones.

(i) An alternative could be to not move the parent page as well until all of the restrictions are included in the user.
fields.summary: Warning when moving parent pages that have child pages with 'edit' restrictions

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you add a Calendar macro inside a table on Confluence Cloud, the events won't be displayed properly.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a calendar. 
 # Add at least one event that lasts more than one day.
 # Create a page.
 # Add a table to the page.
 # Insert the calendar you have just created using the Calendar macro inside the table.
 # Publish the page.

h3. Expected Results

The events should be displayed correctly on the calendar.

!image-2021-06-10-19-11-25-364.png!
h3. Actual Results

The events don't show properly.

!image-2021-06-10-19-11-53-878.png!
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Team Calendar macro renders in old UI

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When creating a Service Project space in Confluence, we need to choose a Jira project to link to the space. If the instance has *only one* application link, the option to choose a project does not appear and it is not possible to create the space.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Make sure your Confluence instance has only one Application Link to Jira
#  Access *Spaces* on the top bar.
# Click on *Create Space* and select the Software Project Space blueprint.
# Try to create the space.

h3. Expected Results
There should be an option to choose a Jira project while creating the space.
h3. Actual Results

There's no option to choose a Jira project, so nothing happens when clicking on the Create button.

h3. Workaround

The admin can create another application link to the same Jira instance. It won't get successfully created because there's already a link to that site. After that, the dropdown to select a project will show up.
fields.summary: Unable to create a Software Project Space if the instance has only one application link

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a Confluence site has [IP allowlist enabled|https://support.atlassian.com/security-and-access-policies/docs/specify-ip-addresses-for-product-access/], even though the user is already logged-in, when trying to run certain Slack Confluence commands, it will state that the user must log in.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Make sure to [enable IP allowlist|https://support.atlassian.com/security-and-access-policies/docs/specify-ip-addresses-for-product-access/] and add it to a Confluence Cloud site.
# Now, in a Slack workspace, make sure to log in to this site to [integrate Slack with Confluence|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/use-slack-and-confluence-together/] by using the following command:
{code}
/confluence login <site url>
{code}
# Once the authentication is completed, try to use commands like the ones below, which will have different results:
{code}
/confluence whoami
{code}

{code}
/confluence connect <space or page URL>
{code}

h3. Expected Results
The user should be able to use the commands as the authentication is already completed.

h3. Actual Results
The Confluence app in Slack will ask the user to log in:
!Slack_login.png|thumbnail!

{quote}
Hi, USER! I'm here to help you work on Confluence pages and spaces from within Slack.
To perform this action, please authorize Slack & log in to your Confluence Cloud account by typing
/confluence login <site-url>.
{quote}

(i) If the user tries to login again, it will state that the account is already logged in.

h3. Workaround

As an organization administrator, disable IP allowlisting, have the user using any of the commands that prompted to log in again. After that, enabling IP allowlist back will not trigger the issue anymore.
fields.summary: Certain Slack commands will prompt a logged-in user to log in if Confluence has IP Allowlisting enabled

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Legacy editor page with links to another Legacy editor page -Within the same space- stops working with the page is copied to a different Space.

When using the [Insert Link|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-links-and-anchors/#InsertLinks-legacyeditor] on a page with the Legacy editor that links to another page in the Legacy editor -in the same space- when using the Copy Page function and copying the page to another space the link will break
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Have two pages in the same space that utilize the Legacy editor
 2. Add a direct link from page 2 into page 1 in some text
 3. Use the Copy page function:
 !Screenshot 2021-06-10 at 08.04.28.png|width=289,height=173!
 4. Copy to a new space
h3. Expected Results

Links should work and point back to the original location
h3. Actual Results

Links are pointing to Create page dialogue in the destination space

*Example Link Format after Copying page:*

https://<sitename>.atlassian.net/wiki/pages/createpage.action?spaceKey=BSD&title=page%20copy%202&linkCreation=true&fromPageId=1800765541
h3. Workaround

This issue only occurs in the Legacy editor. Using the New editor does not cause this
fields.summary: Legacy editor page with links to another Legacy editor page -Within the same space- stops working with the page is copied to a different Space

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The "Copy page hierarchy" API throws a NullPointerException when the source page has an emoji or a header image in its title.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page with either an emoji or a header image in its title
 # Copy the page using the "copy page hierarchy"

h3. Expected Results

The page hierarchy is successfully copied.
h3. Actual Results

The page hierarchy fails and the response contains a {{NullPointerException}}:

 
{code:java}
"errors":[ 
 { "key":"NullPointerException",
   "type":"ERROR",
   "args":[],
   "translation":null }]
{code}
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: The "Copy page hierarchy" API throws a NullPointerException when the source page has an emoji or a header image in its title

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Import to Sandbox needs to better address inconsistent data/constraint violations that will fail the import if there are deleted attachments pointing to deleted spaceid in content.csv.

Error shown: 
{code:java}
"status":"FAILED"
"statusMessage":"ERROR: insert or update on table "content" violates foreign key constraint "xxxxxxxxxx" Detail: Key (spaceid)=(0000000) is not present in table "spaces"."

 0:"ATTACHMENTS"
 1:"DATA"{code}
The process will fail with "ERROR: insert or update on table "content" violates foreign key constraint.

This happens because the process tries to insert data into content table pointing to an space id that doesn't exist on spaces table.
fields.summary: Improve handling inconsistent data that could lead to constraint violations

fields.description:
Currently, at Confluence Server, it is possible to create a URL to be used out of Confluence that can create a page from a template at some specific space defined by the user. This feature might be very useful on Confluence Cloud as well because it can be used out of confluence or in other Atlassian products like Jira or Jira Service Management.

URL used in server:
https://<siteURL>/pages/createpage-enter variables.action?templateId=<templateID>&spaceKey=<SpaceKey>
fields.summary: Create a Page From Template URL

fields.description:
h3. *Problem*

Currently, it's only possible to add Boards on a page using the Agile Wallboard Gadget macro, but it only works with Kanban and Scrum Jira Software boards.
h3. *Suggestion*

Add a macro where it's possible to embed Jira Core/Work Management Boards.
fields.summary: Ability to embed Jira Work Management Board on Confluence pages

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The Macro body only shows an empty extension frame instead of a placeholder when editing the macro settings.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

(i) The issue has been reproduced with a specific macro, but other macros might be affected as well.
 # Make sure the "[New approach to Confluence Cloud macros|https://community.developer.atlassian.com/t/it-s-time-to-dogfood-your-apps-with-the-new-approach-to-confluence-cloud-macros/45151]" is available on the site
 # Add a Macro to a Confluence page (e.g. the "[Miro embed for Confluence|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1224156/miro-embed-for-confluence]")
 # Edit the Macro settings with the page in editing mode (e.g. Enter an invalid or an empty URL)
 # Save the page
 # Re-open the page in edit mode

h3. Expected Results

The placeholder value loads.
h3. Actual Results

An empty extension frame loads (see [^CONFCLOUD72277.mp4] )
h3. Notes

The placeholder content loads when the page is open in view mode.
h3. Workaround

Reload the page for the placeholder to load.
fields.summary: The Macro body only shows an empty extension frame instead of a placeholder when editing the macro settings

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

On a spaces overview page a random ; appears at the bottom. It can not be detected through the source code of the page and does not appear in the editor. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to a Space Over View Page
 # Edit the page and make changes
 # Save them and the ; appear.
 # Editor and Source code show no ;

h3. Expected Results

Don't show ; at the bottom of the space overview page
h3. Actual Results

There is a random ; at the bottom of the page:

!Screen Shot 2021-06-08 at 5.48.02 PM.png|width=538,height=275!
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Random ; appears on space overview page

fields.description:
Currently, when the *Copy Data to Sandbox* process fails, the customer receives an email mentioning that the process failed, however, there isn't any details available of it.

It would be nice to have those details as small failures (e. g. copy of only a few spaces) can be manually solved by exporting/importing the failed spaces instead of copying the entire instance again.
fields.summary: Improved visibility of errors/logging when attempting to Copy Data to Sandbox.
Enabling/disabling public links not logging correctly on Confluence Audit Log

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

For unlicensed Confluence users (e.g. JSM knowledge base users) Space directory may appear empty or have missing results.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Have a site with both Confluence and Jira Service management 
# Make some spaces to become knowledge bases for Jira Service Management projects. To do so, you can [link the Confluence spaces to your service projects|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-management-cloud/docs/link-confluence-spaces-to-your-service-project/]
# Grant a user with Confluence access via the site's administration.
# Now, [add this user with individual permissions|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/assign-space-permissions/] to "View" a space that is not integrated with Jira Service Management nor is [open for the public access|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/set-up-public-access/].
# Revoke the user's access from Confluence via the site's administration, but, keep this user as an active customer account with site access, like the example below:
!access_JSM.png|thumbnail!
# Visit the Space directory as the unlicensed/customer (JSM) user

h3. Expected Results

The space directory should list all spaces which are open to unlicensed and anonymous users.

h3. Actual Results

The space directory appears blank.

h3. Workaround

Remove any existing individual space permissions associated with the user as the groups will automatically be revoked from the user when becoming a "customer" account without Confluence access.
fields.summary: Granting space permissions for a JSM customer will make the space directory to not display spaces for the user

fields.description: Many of the existing search tests in the monolith mock the old search platform - csp. As an improvement action we should adapt all of these tests to the new platform.
fields.summary: PIR AI - Adapt CSP acceptance tests to new search platform

fields.description: We can send metrics on the cardinality of the permission set we retrieve for a piece of content and the cardinality of the set we index and send an alert if discrepancies appear
fields.summary: PIR AI - add sfx alert for permission indexing discrepancies

fields.description: Expand/improve test classes for ContentPermissionIndexerExtractor, SpaceContainerIndexerExtractor, GroupNamestoGroupARIsConverter to cover all desired permissions behavior
fields.summary: PIR AI - Improve tests for indexing permissions classes

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In the new editor, [Page Properties Report|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-page-properties-report-macro/] macros containing [Panel Macros|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-panel-macro/] display the panels without color intermittently. The colors reappear and disappear on subsequent reloads.  _Note that with the Note panel macro, the icon also doesn't display at all._ 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a few new pages with a Page Properties macro, and add a Panel macro in one of the key/value pairs. Make sure to add a test label to those pages.
 # Create a new page with the Page Properties Report macro and assign the test label.
 # Load the page. The Panel macros may display without color. On page reload, note if the color displays as expected.

h3. Expected Results

Panel Macros display as they do in the initial table. 

!image-2021-06-08-11-21-46-213.png|width=501,height=207!
h3. Actual Results

!CleanShot 2021-06-03 at 12.34.26@2x.png|width=250,height=148!   !CleanShot 2021-06-03 at 12.34.09@2x.png|width=250,height=168!
h3. Workaround

A [status macro|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-status-macro/] could be a helpful replacement depending on the length requirement—otherwise, no current workaround.
fields.summary: Panel macros display improperly placed inside a Page Properties Report macro

fields.description:
Pages node in the PT to look like it does in Space Settings > Content Tools > Reorder Pages where the homepage/overview IS the parent of all the pages in the space.

Basically, the pages feature displays all the pages in the current space but users are getting confused by seeing the pages outside of the hierarchy.
fields.summary: Remove Pages feature from space Sidebar

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Task report macro does not display any data if the current space is selected.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page in a test space and add an action item
 # On the same space, create another page and add task report macro
# Choose *current space* for Space(s) and page(s) field.
# Save


h3. Expected Results

The task report macro will display the data created in step 1.

h3. Actual Results

No data is being displayed.

h3. Workaround

Instead of putting current space, put the space name.
fields.summary: Task report macro does not display for current space

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In a premium instance with both Jira and Confluence, if there's any IP allowlisting set to Jira, it won't be possible to create a Jira event on Team Calendars

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set an [IP allowlist|https://support.atlassian.com/security-and-access-policies/docs/specify-ip-addresses-for-product-access/] enabled for Jira
# Go to Team Calendars and try to create any Jira event (Jira Issue Dates, Jira Agile Sprints or Jira Project Releases)
# Select JQL and type any valid query

h3. Expected Results
It should retrieve the date fields

h3. Actual Results
An error is shown:
{code:none}Something went wrong.
Please try again later.{code}
| !Screen Shot 2021-06-07 at 8.51.10 PM.png|thumbnail! |
The following request responds with a 500 status:
{code:none}Request URL: https://INSTANCE.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/calendar-services/1.0/calendar/jira/b5f97ee2-(...)-bca79c89bd44/date-fields/jql.json?query=text~test
Request Method: GET
Status Code: 500 {code}
Response
{code:json}["The response from text~test didn't make sense"]{code}


h3. Workaround
At this time, the only workaround available is to disable Jira's IP Allowlist
fields.summary: Can't create Jira events on TC if Jira uses IP allowlist

fields.description:

Create space workflow does not have covering integration tests.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

None
h3. Expected Results

Create space should be covered in integration test suite
h3. Actual Results

Create space is not covered in integration test suite
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: PIR [PIR-9274] Action item - Add basic acceptance tests for creating new space workflow (Cypress)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

'Contributors macro' is not displaying the correct data in the customer's instance.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add the contributors macro to a page
 # Observe the results does not match user edits

h3. Expected Results

Users should be listed based on the last contributor
h3. Actual Results

Users are displayed incorrectly and not always based on who contributed last
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Contributors macro displaying incorrect information

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a user taps an attachment from the [search function|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/search-for-pages-and-posts] and it is added to non-overview pages, it will open the page instead of displaying the attachment's preview.

(i) If the attachment is from a space home/overview, it will open the preview instead of the page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a page under the overview page of the space.
# Attach an attachment to this page.
# Use the [quick or advanced search|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/search-for-pages-and-posts] to have the attachment displayed in the results.
# Tap the attachment.

h3. Expected Results

A preview of the attachment should be displayed.

h3. Actual Results

Only the page where the attachment is located will open.

*Additional notes*

* Although the user is redirected to the page, the URL will point to a preview:
{code}
https://sitename.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/SACEKEY/pages/494069055546/image+test?preview=%2F494069055546%2F494104772727%2Fattachment.png
{code}
* A 401 is displayed in the browser's console.
* Attachments added to the "Overview" page will not face the same phenomenon. They will have its preview open and redirect the user to the *Attachments* part of the page.

h3. Workaround

* Move the attachment to the overview page so it can be searched and opened.
* Tap the attachment after being redirected to the page.
fields.summary: Tapping attachments from non-overview pages in a search will open the page instead of its preview

fields.description:
h3. Users should not be able to add/move child pages under a restricted page

Current situation: Users who have the Add page rights under space permissions are able to add pages under restricted pages where the VIEW-only rights are given. 

Desired Situation: They should only be able to add/move pages under restricted pages when EDIT rights are given.
fields.summary: Users should not be able to add/move child pages under a restricted page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
h5. Situation #1:
 - Upon attempting to insert a Roadmap Macro into a page after making editing it, the changes are not saved.

h5. Situation #2:
 - After inserting a new lane, you won't be able to rename the lane right away. You can access the edit screen but it won't' allow you to edit it.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
h5. Situation #1:
 # Add a Roadmap Planner macro
 # Spend some time creating the roadmap. (30-40 minutes)
 # Click Insert
 # Occasionally, the changes will not appear on the preview screen. It tends to occur when you've spent a significant amount of time on the roadmap.

h5. Situation #2:
 # Add a Roadmap Planner macro
 # Add a Lane
 # Try to rename the lane that was just added

h3. Expected Results
 - The changes to the roadmap should appear on the preview screen.
 - You should be able to rename the lane after adding.

h3. Actual Results
h5. Situation #1:
 - The changes do not appear in the Preview screen. This behavior is not consistent.

h5. Situation #2:
 - You can access the edit screen but it won't allow you to edit it.

h3. Workaround
h5. Situation #1:

The cause of this is still being investigated. At this time, there is not a known workaround.
h5. Situation #2:
 # Add a Roadmap Planner macro
 # Add a Lane
 # Insert to Roadmap Planner macro
 # Edit the Roadmap Planner macro
 # Then, edit the Lane.

h3. Notes

In the case of changes not appearing as saved, there have been some who have noticed the issue tends to resolve on its own.
fields.summary: Changes not saved when editing Roadmap Planner

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When attempting to edit a page there is no edit icon. the Lock icon shows and displays as there are no present restrictions.

!Missing edit button with unlock.png|width=415,height=85,thumbnail!  

!no restrictions.png|width=394,height=126,thumbnail!

!Actual page restriction is in place.png|width=386,height=363,thumbnail!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have the author add an edit restriction to a page
 # Add everyone as view only
 # Someone other than the author:
 ## The page will show as uneditable while displaying no restrictions
 # The author will have access to edit the page, others will not.

h3. Expected Results

Anyone other than the author should see the restriction on the page.
h3. Actual Results

The page shows no restrictions and is uneditable.
h3. Workaround

Have the author remove restrictions if possible (Not always applicable)
fields.summary: Unable to edit page, hidden restrictions

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Numbered/bullet lists are great when we are creating our articles! They are very useful to approach with step-by-step processes and to outline topics of our subjects.
Although this great feature works well in most of times, it doesn't support the *iframe* macro, breaking the list as soon as you try to insert it.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page;
# Insert a numbered/bullet list;
# In the list, insert the *iframe* macro and embed any site.

h3. Expected Results
The macro is added to the list, keeping its formatting to continue the numbered/bullet list.

h3. Actual Results

Currently disabling the Slack app on an instance does not remove it completely from the Confluence UI, it keeps being displayed among the share options.
 !Screen Shot 2021-06-03 at 10.46.11 AM.png!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to *Settings > Manage add-ons*.
 # Select *System* from the drop-down.
 # Select *Slack Notifications* from the displayed apps and click *Configure*.
 # Turn off the toggle to disable the app.

h3. Expected Results
once it is disabled, anything related to it should be removed and not displayed at Confluence UI.
h3. Actual Results
Even if it is disabled, slack keep being displayed among the share page options without working, after clicking on it a different message is displayed:
   !Screen Shot 2021-06-03 at 2.26.06 PM.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Disable slack app won't remove it from the share options

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using the [Page Properties Report macro|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-page-properties-report-macro/] to retrieve data from the [Page Properties|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-page-properties-macro/], if the page with the Page Properties macro has action items within the table, these will not be able to be checked/unchecked on the page using the Page Properties Report macro.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page to add the [Page Properties|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-page-properties-macro/] macro to it.
 # On this page, make sure to add a table to the Page Properties field and add some action items to its row(s). Add a label to this page so it can be retrieved later.
 # On a new page, add the [Page Properties Report|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-page-properties-report-macro/] macro and include the label added to the previous page on its configuration.
 # Check/uncheck the added action items

h3. Expected Results

The action items should be checked/unchecked.
h3. Actual Results

Nothing happens, as if the action items were pure text.
h3. Workaround

Check/uncheck the items in the original page containing the Page Properties macro so it will be reflected on the page with the Page Properties Report one.
fields.summary: Checking action items on the Page Properties Report macro won't work

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using the [Page Properties Report macro|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-page-properties-report-macro/] (with the new macro configuration view) to retrieve data from the [Page Properties|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-page-properties-macro/], the "Label" field is mandatory. However, if the user does not add a label to the field, the macro will still be able to be added to the page and retrieve content from other pages with the Page Properties Report macro within the space.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page and edit it.
 # Add the [Page Properties Report|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-page-properties-report-macro/] macro.
 # Do not add any labels into the "Labels" field.
!page_properties.png|width=160,height=181!
 # Publish the page

h3. Expected Results

Similar to how the old view of the macro works, the macro should not be able to be added to the page until the mandatory field is filled.

h3. Actual Results

The macro is added to the page. As an additional note, all pages with the [Page Properties macro|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-page-properties-macro/] within the same space will automatically have their content added to the macro without the label.


h3. Workaround

Besides editing the page to re-add the label, there is no known workaround for this behavior.
fields.summary: Not adding a label to the Page Properties Report macro will allow it to be added to the page

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In Confluence, the tasks/action items in the [Page Properties Report|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-page-properties-report-macro/] macro are missing styling. For example, the dates no longer show up in different colors for past due, upcoming, and long-term. Tasks show up as a bullet point instead of a checkbox.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page and include the [Page Properties Report macro|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-page-properties-report-macro/]
 # Include tasks in a page using the [Page Properties macro|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-page-properties-macro/]

h3. Expected Results

Formatting should remain the same, including various colors for the state of tasks, and checkboxes.
h3. Actual Results

Formatting appears to be missing:
 * Tasks do not have checkboxes. They become bullet points instead.
 * Content like panels will miss its formatting (I.E. the info panel).

h3. Workaround
 * Edit the page and publish it again.
 * Have a [Include page macro|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-include-page-macro/] added to the page and pointing to the same page using the *Page Properties* macro or another one that has action items. This will force the bullet points to keep being action items.
 * Use other macros like the [Include page macro|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-include-page-macro/] or [Excerpt include|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-excerpt-include-macro/] to retrieve content from another page.
fields.summary: Page Property Report Macro tasks no longer show up with checkboxes after page refresh. They are now just bulleted lists

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
While it is possible to filter the spaces by its categories, by adding a label on the space settings and display a list of those in the all spaces section, when we choose a category to filter the spaces there by using the dropdown button, it will only show up to 25 spaces in the list, even if there is more spaces with the label for that category.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create at least 26 - 30 spaces
 # Add a label  to the space, on the *Space Settings > Overview* and click on *Edit*, next to the *Categories*, eg.: test and click *Done* to save it
# Go to the Navigation bar > *Spaces > View All Spaces*
# Click on the dropdown menu to filter by categories, by default it will be on "all categories"
# Change it to show the spaces with the label eg.: test.

h3. Expected Results
It should show up the 26 - 30 spaces created and added the label *test*

h3. Actual Results
It will only show up to 25 results, even if you have 26 spaces or more.

h3. Workaround
Choose the category on the dropdown button and refresh the page, it should show up all the results for the spaces with the given label.
fields.summary: Filtering all spaces by categories will only show the full list of spaces after a refresh

fields.description:
Hello.

It should be possible for a Site-admin to remove the admin permission of a poersonal space owner.

As the administrators of the instance we should be given the tools to manage all the content and accesses of the Instance, whether it's a JIRA project or a Confluence Personal or not space. We might decide that for example, personal spaces are not to be shared with any other members of the team, so, we might want to remove only the admin permissions to the owners.

If a user has a personal space and has admin permissions to it he can do lot's of things he doesn't even know is doing, like for ex using the personal space to share work content with another team, and them he leaves the company and the space lies there as a zombie space and not managed centrally. And deleting it might make us loose important information and we don't know about it.

 

So, being able to remove "Admin" permissions to the personal space owner is a must.

Thank you.

 

Filipe
fields.summary: Grant the site-admins the possibility to remove a personal space owner the Admin permission

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary The issue happens after restoring a backup file from Confluence Cloud into Confluence Server or Data Center. It seems that after the implementation of the new editor in Confluence Cloud the note macro has been replaced by the note panel macro and that macro has a different code than the one from Server versions and because of that, the macro is not being restored correctly. h3. Steps to Reproduce # Create a Page within Confluence Cloud. # Add a note macro with any content on it. # Create an export file of the instance by going to !https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/files/747833194/747833195/2/1517274813281/cog.png|width=16! > *Backup Manager* # Select the option *"Create backup for server"*. # Restore that file in a Confluence Server/Datacenter instance by following the steps at [Migrate from Confluence Cloud to Server|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/migrate-from-confluence-cloud-to-server]. h3. Expected Results The note panel macro from Confluence Cloud should be converted to a note macro in Confluence Server/Data Center. h3. Actual Results The macro is restored in the Confluence Instance but not in the same way that it was set in Cloud as we can see in the image below:   !Error.png|width=351,height=236!   If we check the differences in the storage format from both Cloud and Server it's possible to see that the code is different. Here are the differences between the macros in both versions: * *Macro created by Confluence Cloud*: {code:xml}


note

Documentation

  • Sample Link

Documentation

  • Sample Link


{code} * *Macro created by Confluence Server:* {code:xml}


Documentation
  • Sample Link




{code} h3. Workaround Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior.
fields.summary: Restoring a backup from Cloud is creating broken macros in Server/DC.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Jira Custom fields with same name do not render values using Jira-issue macro

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a custom field and associate it with a company-managed project.
 # Create another custom field with the same name withing a team-managed project. 
 # Using Jira Issues Macro(Confluence) display the issues containing the custom fields from any of the projects that were created in step 1 or 2.
 # In the display options(Jira issue macro)choose the custom field.
 # Save the page.

h3. Expected Results
The values from the custom fields should be displayed

h3. Actual Results
The values from the custom fields is not being rendered as Jira-issue macro finds there are more than one custom fields with the same name. 

h3. Workaround
Rename the custom field in the Team managed project in way that is distinguishable from the exisitng custom field used in the company managed project(s).
fields.summary: Jira Custom fields with same name do not render values using Jira-issue macro

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Headers that are using parentheses are getting their anchor links broken when the page is updated through Rest API.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Page
 # insert a header that contains parentheses,
 # Try to create an anchor link for it using the update API that contains the same parentheses that are displayed on the header created before,
 # For Example:
 # {code:html}
<a href="#anchor-(test)">
{code}

h3. Expected Results

It should create an anchor link that points to the referenced header.
h3. Actual Results

It generates a broken link and nothing happen when you click on it.

h3. Workaround

replace the parentheses at the href= for their URL format that is %28 for open parentheses and %29 for close parentheses. like the example below:
{code:html}
<a href="#anchor-%28test%29">
{code}
fields.summary: Failed to reference headers with parentheses via update API #anchor-(test)

h3. Expected Results

it should be able to see the video screen complete without margin or horizontal scroll bar.

The video screen is not completely displayed on the page.
h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

h3. Issue Summary

Anchor links do not show properly on the PDF file after exporting a page

 # *Create* a page
 # Add a link to another Confluence page with an anchor
 # *Publish* the page
 # Click on the *...* > *Export* > *Export to PDF*

h3. Expected Results

The link should keep the same appearance as it has on the published page

!Screen Shot 2021-05-31 at 16.46.49.png!

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

[https://getsupport.atlassian.com/browse/JST-659054]

Certain users get an error when accessing *space settings->content tools->attachments.* The error is due to an InvalidSearchException which is thrown due to a permissions violation ** 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Impersonate affected user 
 # access {{*Request URL:* }}{{[https://pronovias.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/listattachmentsforspace.action?key=IJSM]}}
 # {{get error page unavailable }}

h3. Expected Results

Access the attachments tab
h3. Actual Results

500 error is received
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Attachments tab displays errors for some users

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you change a space's name by UI or API, the content in side the space is not reindexed, so if you search for it, the search results will be displayed with the old space name. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Change a space's name
 # Search for content inside the space

h3. Expected Results

The search results reflect the new space name 
h3. Actual Results

The search results reflect the old space name
h3. Workaround

Make small edits to the content in the space so that it is reindexed with the new space name, or reindex the whole tenant.
fields.summary: Changing space names is not reflected in search for content in space

fields.description:
Currently, the sql file is displayed like this in preview
{code}
1 select *
2 from test
3 where test = test
{code}
If you copy the above, you'll even copy the numbers. It also causes line breaks.
 !AtlassianSupport 2021-05-26 11.02.20.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Improve .sql file preview

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Searching for questions that have verbs with a suffix (e.g. -ly, -ed, -ing) will not display any results.

Question as an example: "They asked a question"

If you search for "They ask", the search works fine:
 !Screen Shot 2021-05-25 at 11.24.56.png|thumbnail!
 After adding the suffix "They asked", the search fails:
 !Screen Shot 2021-05-25 at 11.25.13.png|thumbnail!
  
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add Questions for Confluence to your instance.
 # Click on *Apps > Questions.*
 # Create a question having a verb with a suffix.
 # Search for the question and write the verb with the suffix used.

h3. Expected Results

The search should display the question.
h3. Actual Results

The search displays no results after writing the suffix of the verb.
h3. Workaround

At the moment, users should search for questions without adding the suffixes to the verbs.
fields.summary: Questions for Confluence: search fails to find questions after writing the suffix of a verb (e.g. -ed, -ly, -ing)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Investigate the intermittent issue described in https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/ESSD-562

h3. Steps to Reproduce
No steps, happens intermittently

h3. Expected Results
No errors

h3. Actual Results
Receiving error: com.atlassian.jwt.exception.JwtExpiredException: Expired at Thu Apr 01 06:52:17 UTC 2021 and time is now Thu Apr 01 06:58:02 UTC 2021 (30 seconds leeway is allowed)

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Investigate expired JWT token issue for page_updated webhook

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a user's account preferences are set to Deutsch, the date element in the legacy editor shows as "Y" instead of the year. 
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Change your language preference to Deutsch: refer to [Manage your language preferences|https://support.atlassian.com/atlassian-account/docs/manage-your-language-preferences].
 # Navigate to your Confluence site, reload the page to make sure the site is now in German.
 # Edit a page on the legacy editor.
 # Insert the date macro: Type // and select a date.

h3. Expected Results

!expected.png!
h3. Actual Results

!actual.png!
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no workaround for this behavior in the legacy editor.
 
 * Note that on the published page, you see the expected date (21.05.2021).
 * When you edit the page after publishing, you also see the expected date (21.05.2021).
fields.summary: Date element in legacy editor is showing "Y" instead of year for German users

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
 * When we add a new variable in the standard template its not visible during the page creation.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Edit a standard template under space settings-> content tools -> template
 # Add some text and add a new variable using new variable <> macro.
 # Save the changes and promote the template
 # Create a new page using that template 

h3. Expected Results

Variable should be visible on the page 
 
h3. Actual Results

Variavle is missing from the template while page creation but the text is visible 
h3. Workaround

Copy the standard template to a custom one and add variable to it.
fields.summary: Adding a new variable in Standard templates is not working

fields.description:
There are a number of different kinds of Confluence content. Examples include spaces, pages, blogs, page comments, inline comments and custom content (contributed by Connect apps).

App developers would benefit from a guide explaining the relationship between these different kinds of content.

Such a guide, for example, would explain if it makes sense that custom content can be created in a different space than its container as explained in https://community.developer.atlassian.com/t/custom-content-can-be-created-in-different-space-than-its-container/47829.
fields.summary: Guide required to explain content model

When images are placed inside the table , from page operation if PDF export is made , the images are missing in export.

We will add more information with respect to logs.
fields.summary: Images inside the table are not getting exported in PDF

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, it's not possible to align elements (images, text and other macros) inside of any macro.

h3. Suggested Solution
Implement the ability to align elements inside of macros.
fields.summary: Option to align elements inside of macros

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When requesting a certain content through Confluence's /rest/api/content endpoint, the *publicName* field will give the wrong information sometimes (around 10% of the time during tests)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page and publish it
# Edit it with a different user and publish it again
# Get its ID and perform the following get request:
{code:none}/wiki/rest/api/content/PAGE_ID{code}
# Perform the request a few more times 

h3. Expected Results
It should present the following information 100% of the time:
{code:json}version: {
        by: {
            type: "known",
            accountId: "59xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxdb9daa",
            accountType: "atlassian",
            email: "",
            publicName: "Test User",
            profilePicture: {
                path: "/wiki/aa-avatar/59xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxdb9daa",
                width: 48,
                height: 48,
                isDefault: false
            },
            displayName: "Test User",
            isExternalCollaborator: false,{code}

h3. Actual Results
Sometimes, the following information is returned:
{code:json}version: {
        by: {
            type: "known",
            accountId: "59xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxdb9da",
            accountType: "",
            email: "",
            publicName: "User db9da",
            profilePicture: {
                path: "/wiki/aa-avatar/59xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxdb9da",
                width: 48,
                height: 48,
                isDefault: false
            },
            displayName: "Test User",
            isExternalCollaborator: false,{code}

(i) When this happens, we noticed it affects the *publicName* for all different users in the response.

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Content api gives wrong public name information sometimes

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

New spaces are not using default space logo
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to ⚙️ (*Settings*) in the Confluence navigation > *Default Space Logo*  
 # Select *Logo:ON* 
 # Select *Choose File* to upload a new logo
 # Select *Upload Logo* 
 # Select *Save*
 # Go to *Spaces* and *Create space*

h3. Expected Results
 * The new space's logo should be the default space logo uploaded 

h3. Actual Results
 * The new space's logo is a random icon from Atlassian's gallery

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: New spaces are not using default space logo

fields.description:
Improve the templates from [Atlassian Templates|https://www.atlassian.com/software/confluence/templates/categories/featured] so it can be possible to choose on wich space and page tree the user wants to create the page using that template,

Currently, when you hit the "Create a Page" button it opens a draft page on your personal space, if you don't have one it opens on the latest space that you created but if you never created one the draft is open on the most recent created space of that instance.

This functionality's best behavior would be to let the user choose where he wants the draft to open.
fields.summary: Provide a way to Choose Where the template from Atlassian should be open

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When we have a space will multiple pages in different levels, pages in certain levels will have their titles printed in a very small font in the PDF export.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page tree with the following structure:
** Page 1
*** Page 2
**** Page 3
***** Page 4
****** Page 5
******* Page 6
# Export the space to PDF

h3. Expected Results
Pages should have their titles printed with a consistent font, or at least not a very small one.

h3. Actual Results
In my example, the page at the 5th level will have its title printed/ exported with a small font:
| !space_structure.png|thumbnail! |
| !pdf_export_.png|thumbnail! |

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: PDF export uses very small font for certain page titles

fields.description:
Hello,

 

I am a Software Engineer at OneValley, and recently I have been alerted to some security issues by some of my clients that I build platforms for. One my clients (Amazon) has informed me of ‘tabnapping’ vulnerabilities on Confluence, essentially making it potentially susceptible. There are some Confluence links with <a> tags that do not have the proper security set up, but I have a sugggestion to resolve this. 

 

_Add `rel="noopener noreferrer"` as an attribute to links that look like `<a href="..." target="_blank">`_

 

This is something slowly other clients have also started to bring up so it’s a security investment that would be worthwhile to take a look into.
fields.summary: Tabnapping Vulnerabilities

fields.description:
Hello,

 

I am a Software Engineer at OneValley, and recently I have been alerted to some security issues by some of my clients that I build platforms for. One my clients (Amazon) has informed me of CSP issues on Confluence, essentially making it potentially susceptible to XSS attacks. To resolve this issue there has been a suggestion made. 

 

_Replace insecure traffic (served over HTTP) with secure traffic upgrade-insecure-requests. The default setting for all the *-src directives. Preferred 'none', but 'self' or your CDN domain is fine.  - If not specified the default for all the *-src directives is `*` default-src 'none’. Always configure, regardless of your `default-src` setting. Console services cannot use object, embed or applet elements. object-src 'none’._

 

This is something slowly other clients have also started to bring up so it’s a security investment that would be worthwhile.
fields.summary: Content Security Policy (CSP) Vulnerabilities

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
 * JIRA Issue Macro displays an empty field for *Team* Confluence Cloud <-> Jira on prem (8.13.x)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page on {*}Confluence Cloud{*}.
 # Add a *Jira Issue Macro* pointing to the on prem Jira instance
 # Configure the *filter* and expand "Display Options".
 # Set the display to Table and add *Team* under "Columns to display".
 # Add the macro and {*}save the page{*}.

h3. Expected Results
 * The Team column gets populated.

h3. Actual Results
 * The columns are blank.

h3. Workaround
 * -Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.-
 * For most of the case, this issue is caused by there are more than one Jira field name {*}'Team'{*}.  When user choose *'Team'* under "Columns to display", Confluence macro can't recognize which *'Team'* is selected.  Workaround will be change the Jira field name and avoid duplicate name here, like 'product team', 'engineering team', 'involved teams', etc
 * This should be convert to a Suggestion Feature ticket.
fields.summary: Team field blank on Jira Issue Macro (Confluence Cloud/Jira on prem)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
While it is possible to copy the text and the status macro from the view page in Confluence Cloud on the fabric editor, if we paste it on a word document, google docs or gmail, the color from the status macro won't be carried over to those documents/e-mails, but will be bold instead.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page
 # Insert some text 
 # Insert the Status macro with Green color for example
 # Select the text with the Status macro as well
# Paste it on a gmail draft

h3. Expected Results
It would paste the text and the status macro color the same way it was from the Confluence page

h3. Actual Results
The text is only bold, but doesn't have the colors from the Status macro.

h3. Workaround
The legacy editor pages upon having the text select and copied, works with the Status macro colors being pasted on other documents without any issues.

Another workaround would be after pasting the text, double click on the macro only, ctrl+c or cmd+c and select on the document/email the bold text and paste it. The color should be there as expected.
fields.summary: Copying some text with the Status macro from the view mode, won't carry over the macro color

fields.description:
Currently, Confluence users are unable to add a search box on the sidebar, as it was possible to add on Confluence Server (see [Configure the Sidebar|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/configure-the-sidebar-317194694.html] page). 

h4. Suggestion

It would be nice to provide a feature that allows Confluence users to add a search field to the sidebar.
fields.summary: Add search field on the sidebar

fields.description:

fields.summary: Ability to mention Atlassian Teams with more than 50 members

fields.description:
Create a functionality that can quickly convert a page to a Global Template or a Space Template.

Currently, the only way to do it is by editing the page, copying its content, creating a template, and paste it there.
fields.summary: Convert Pages to Template Functionality

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Advanced search returns results from only certain types of attachments, which appears to include searching by extension type. (ref: [Search for pages and posts|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/search-for-pages-and-posts/])
 * Word
 * Text
 * PowerPoint
 * Excel
 * PDF
 * HTML

For example, search attachments with the .pdf extension:

!image-2021-05-20-15-19-37-437.png|width=301,height=178!

Search for .mp4 attachments:

!image-2021-05-20-15-20-21-387.png|width=299,height=176!

It seems that Confluence doesn't treat the extension as part of the filename. Searching for an attachment by file extension appears to only work with the file types listed above. Limiting to search title only has the same effect.
h3. Proposed Solution

Allow Advanced Search to search additional attachment types.
fields.summary: Provide ability for additional attachment types in Advanced Search

fields.description:
When creating an event on Team Calendars, the calendar label is always filled with the first calendar created for that space.

It will be good to create an option to set a calendar as default to be automatically inserted on calendar labels when creating an event, this will be very useful because sometimes the first created calendar is not the most used in that space.
fields.summary: Create a Default Calendar Option for Spaces

fields.description:

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Content of a custom *user picker* field is not being displayed on Jira issue/filter macro in Confluence pages.

This happens to both *single* and *multiple* users.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Jira project.
 # Create a custom *user picker* field (multiple or single users).
 # Add the field to an issue type.
 # Populate the field.
 # Create a Confluence page.
 # Add the "Jira issue/filter" macro to this page.
 # Create a query to search project where you added information to the custom *user picker* field created.
 # Open the *Display options* of the macro
 # Add the custom field created in the *Columns to display*

h3. Expected Results

The macro will show the columns set in the search of your macro and the proper information of those fields.
h3. Actual Results

The custom *user picker* field is not populated.
h3. Workaround

There is no workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Jira issue/filter macro is not showing information from custom user picker field created in Jira
